msgSnippet: I think we should test each method (if possible), and test the functionality of each class, which might involve other classes. But there are some guidelines

I think we should test each method (if possible), and test the
"functionality of each class, which might involve other classes.

But there are some guidelines (in books and articles on JUnit) that try to
keep the tests as self contained as possible.

 

Hope this helps,

-Kamal.

 

  _____  

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
Marcy Spector
Sent: Tuesday, February 21, 2006 2:37 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Unit Testing question

 

Hi All-
  
  This is not directly related to JUnit, but there is a heated discussion
internally here about what a 'unit' is - is it a method or a class?
  
  What's a better approach - isolate each method and test accordingly, or
test at the class level?
  
  TIA.
